benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts - Retrieve an account by external key

covered: GET Valid Request: Happy paths covered with default params and optional flags (balance, CBA, audit FULL/MINIMAL).
Empty/Not Found: 404 covered for nonexistent externalKey and empty database.
Query Parameters: Extensive coverage for valid/invalid combinations, missing required param, extra/ignored params, boundary lengths, and special-character handling.
Authorization: 401 covered for missing and invalid authentication tokens.
Content Type: application/json verified on success.
Robust error handling: 400 for invalid inputs, plus 502/503/504 for dependency/infrastructure failures (beyond story but valuable).
Performance: Response time under normal and concurrent load covered.
Security: Injection and XSS attempts covered and rejected.
Backward compatibility/regression: Legacy/simple clients and problematic historical keys covered.
Pagination: Not applicable for single-resource retrieval (externalKey is required).
gaps: Caching behavior: No checks for ETag/Last-Modified or Cache-Control headers; no conditional GET (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since) and 304 handling.
Rate limiting/throttling: No scenarios validating 429 Too Many Requests, Retry-After headers, or backoff behavior.
Authorization depth: No 403 Forbidden/insufficient scope or tenant-permission scenarios (if applicable to the API).
Accept/content negotiation: No tests for Accept header handling (e.g., Accept=application/json vs unsupported types leading to 406).
Method semantics: No negative tests for unsupported methods on this endpoint (e.g., POST/PUT/PATCH/DELETE -> 405) or HEAD behavior.

Explicit defaults: No scenario explicitly sending audit=NONE to confirm enum handling; no explicit false values (accountWithBalance=false, accountWithBalanceAndCBA=false) to verify parsing of boolean false.
Schema validation: Success and error payloads are not validated against the documented Account schema and standard error structure (fields, types, required properties).
Input normalization: No tests for trimming whitespace, case sensitivity of externalKey, URL-encoded spaces/plus signs, or Unicode keys.
Header validations: No verification of standard headers like correlation/request ID, charset in Content-Type, or consistent error codes/messages format.
recommendations: Add caching scenarios: verify Cache-Control and ETag/Last-Modified on 200; perform conditional GET with If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since expecting 304 when unchanged.
Add rate limiting tests: burst requests to trigger 429, assert Retry-After and correct behavior once the limit resets.
Expand authorization: add 403 Forbidden for authenticated user lacking permissions/tenant access (if the service enforces RBAC/tenancy).
Test content negotiation: set Accept=application/json (200) and unsupported Accept (e.g., text/xml) expecting 406.
Verify method handling: send POST/PUT/PATCH/DELETE to the endpoint expecting 405 with Allow header; optionally test HEAD (headers only, no body).
Exercise explicit defaults: send audit=NONE and booleans explicitly set to false to confirm correct behavior and parity with defaults.
Add schema validations: assert the Account object matches the #/definitions/Account schema; validate error payloads (error code, message, type) against a standard error schema.
Input normalization: test leading/trailing spaces, mixed case in externalKey, URL-encoded spaces (+ vs %20), and Unicode keys to ensure consistent lookup and validation.
Augment header checks: assert charset in Content-Type (e.g., application/json; charset=UTF-8) and presence/format of request ID/correlation ID headers where applicable.
